item.title: Jen add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Jen add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Jen add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I never travel without my diary. One should always have something sensational to read in the train." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Who, being loved, is poor?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To lose one parent may be regarded as a misfortune; to lose both looks like carelessness." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Paradoxically though it may seem, it is none the less true that life imitates art far more than art imitates life." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "No good deed goes unpunished." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I don't want to be at the mercy of my emotions. I want to use them, to enjoy them, and to dominate them." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I choose my friends for their good looks, my acquaintances for their good characters, and my enemies for their good intellects." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The suspense is terrible. I hope it will last." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jen add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jen add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jen add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jen add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "History will be kind to me for I intend to write it." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jen add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "My tastes are simple: I am easily satisfied with the best." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jen add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jen add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you are going through hell, keep going." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jen add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jen add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Personally, I'm always ready to learn, although I do not always like being taught." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Jen add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Now this is the point. You fancy me a mad. Madmen know nothing. But you should have seen me. You should have seen how wisely I proceeded..." -- Edgar Allan Poe
